verses.roman:
he nanda-sūno he rāma
bhavantau vīra-sammatau
niyuddha-kuśalau śrutvā
rājñāhūtau didṛkṣuṇā

synonyms: he nanda-sūno—O son of Nanda; he rāma—O Rāma; bhavantau—You two; vīra—by heroes; sammatau—are well respected; niyuddha—in wrestling; kuśalau—skillful; śrutvā—hearing; rājñā—by the King; āhūtau—called for; didṛkṣuṇā—who wanted to see.
translation: [Cāṇūra said:] O son of Nanda, O Rāma, You two are well respected by courageous men and are both skillful at wrestling. Having heard of Your prowess, the King has called You here, wanting to see for himself.
